intro: Varronia iberica, commonly known as the Iberian varronia, is a shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous seeds. Varronia iberica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate.
